fields.summary: abc [abc-1]

fields.description:
As a user, I'd like to have the ability to create an issue inside the sprint at the Next-Gen project.
Currently, when creating a new issue through + sign on blue left toolbar there is no option to add the issue to a sprint, it will automatically move to the backlog and then I need to drag and drop the card inside the sprint.

It would be great to have the feature to assign the issue into an existing sprint for the Next-Gen project.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to have the ability to create an issue inside the sprint at the Next-Gen project

fields.description:
I've been looking through the forums and have found similar questions, but not quite the exact thing I'm looking for. So I apologize in advance if this question has already been answered and I missed the post (I hate creating duplicates).

I've been playing around with the built-in reports in JIRA, in particular the Workload Pie Chart report. I wanted to see if I could get a report of how many hours an individual in a project has logged across all the tasks he has logged work in. What I found was disappointing.

I made a single test ticket in a brand new fix version (so it was the only ticket available in my query) and assigned it to myself (person A), and logged 5 hours on the task. I then assigned the ticket to a co-worker (person B), and he logged 10 hours on the task. When I ran the workload report by assignee and on time spent, the only person that appeared in the report was person B with a total log time of 15 hours (his hours plus my hours). What I was hoping I would get was person A having 5 hours and person B having 10 hours.

The problem is, person B was the last assignee for the task. And the task currently had 15 hours logged on it. So, the report says that person B has 15 hours logged. The report does not go into the task and extract the hours per individual -- just the total hours on the task and the last person assigned.

So, I think you know my question. How can I generate a time logged report per person regardless of if the task they were involved in was also worked on by other individuals?
fields.summary: How can I generate a report of time logged per person and not per task?

fields.description:
See the screenshot:

!image-2018-11-18-17-42-33-638.png!
fields.summary: Person card is shown under select dropdown

fields.description:
*Problem description*

This evening I tried several ways to get cycle time metrics in a next-gen kanban project. However, none were really successful:
 * the reports section pretty much lacks any kanban metric reports. It only has two scrum metric reports (velocity and burndown charts
 * In the dashboard I tried several chart gadgets:
 ** Average time in status:
 *** hard to read due to it being displayed as a line chart, it would be easier to read as a grouped bar chart with groups per day/month/year, where the bars within the group indicate a state, and the y-axis contains the average.
 *** I found the status multiselect somewhat unusable. For the statuses displayed came from all projects, even though the filter I entered earlier only selected stories from a single project. In turn, this lead to multiple done statuses being displayed in the multi-select. It would be easier if the statuses would be derived from the issues captured by the project selected or issues returned from the filter.
 ** Two dimensional filter statistics
 *** Does a better job with regard to status, than 'average time in status.'
 *** Unfortunately lacks an average time spent in board status.

*Possible solutions*
 * add the control chart for next-gen projects
 * enhance some of the gadgets above to visualise clearly how long, on average, issues spent in a certain column on the kanban board.
 * add a new cycle time gadget for dashboards
fields.summary: Way to measure cycle-time / average time in board column in team-managed projects

fields.description:
h3. Update on 22nd July 2020

Hi Everyone,

 

We are very happy to announce that Project Lead and Default Assignee fields are now modifiable for all next-gen projects on Jira Software and Jira Service Desk. It may take a day or so to roll out to 100% of projects. More details here: [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-articles/Modify-Project-Lead-Default-Assignee-fields-on-next-gen-projects/ba-p/1438466]

We apologize for the delay and hope that this helps our users leverage next-gen projects more effectively moving forward.

 

Regards,
Arjoon Som
Sr. PM, Jira Cloud

 
h3. Problem Definition

User is not able to change Project Lead on existing Agility Project type
h3. Suggested Solution

Add the functionality for user to apply Project Leads to Agility Projects
h3. Workaround

Take the current issues for Agility project and bulk move them to a different project type
 - [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/migrate-from-a-next-gen-project-to-a-classic-project-957974933.html]
 - Alternatively, Atlassian Support is able to manually update the Project Lead.
 - Using *cURL*, you can be able to change the Project Lead of a next-gen Project. Please generate an API token [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/api-tokens-938839638.html]
{code:java}
curl --request PUT \
  --url 'https://<your-instance>.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/project/{projectId}' \
  --user 'email@address.com:API-TOKEN' \
  --header 'Accept: application/json' \
  --header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  --data '{
   "leadAccountId": "5d3b06xxxxxxxxx",
  "projectTypeKey": "software",
  "key": "ABC"
}'
{code}

You will have to run this via a Terminal, enter the details of the new users by using the *accountId*, this can be gotten from https://<your-instance>.atlassian.net/people then search for the user to know the *accountId* which is in an alphanumeric String. Secondly insert the correct project id and project key on the Script prior to running it. This endpoint is gotten from our documentation for [*Update Project*|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/?utm_source=%2Fcloud%2Fjira%2Fplatform%2Frest%2F&utm_medium=302#api-rest-api-3-project-projectIdOrKey-put]

Alternatively, if running curl is proving difficult especially towards Window users, you can download this Free software called [*Postman*|https://www.getpostman.com/] which is able to Perform HTTP request. Please do the following to easily change project lead of next-gen projects.

*Step 1*: Make sure you have Administrator Project role on the next-gen Project
 *Step 2*: Get Postman, and do the below Settings as shown on the images.
||A||B||C||
|!change_project_lead1.png|thumbnail!|!change_project_lead2.png|thumbnail!|!change_project_lead3.png|thumbnail!|

*Step 3*: On the Image A, Click on Authorization tab and select Basic Auth, enter your email address and API token following the guide from [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/api-tokens-938839638.html]
 *Step 4*: On the Image B, Configure the headers as shown on the Image and change the HTTP request to *PUT*. Please indicate the URL as https://<your-instance>.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/project/ABC
 where ABC is your project key.
 *Step 5*: On the Image C, please make sure you add correctly this JSON post
{code:java}
{
"leadAccountId": "5d3b06xxxxxxxxx",
"projectTypeKey": "software",
"key": "ABC"
}
{code}
Where *leadAccountId* is the accountId of the user you want to change to. Final result should be a 200 OK HTTP Status, which means the Project lead has been changed.
fields.summary: As a project administrator, I want to be able to define and change a Project Lead in a next-gen project type

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Sprint Goal is difficult to read due to lack on formatting.

h3. Suggested Solution
Render wiki markup tags on Sprint Goals
fields.summary: Ability to format the Sprint Goal

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Pull requests for the same branch duplicates it in the associated issue

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create project A and an issue A-1; connect a bitbucket account with a repository
# Create, commit something, and push new branches *QA* and *DEV*
# Create a new branch *FOO*, commit there with message "FOO commit", push to Bitbucket
# In Bitbucket, create two Pull Requests:
#* First one: from branch *FOO* to branch *QA*, with name "A-1: first PR"
#* Second one: from branch *FOO* to branch *DEV*, with name "A-1: second PR"

h3. Expected Results
Only one branch *FOO* is added to issue A-1

h3. Actual Results
Check the dev panel for A-1 issue: it will contain 2 branches in summary. If you click, you should see FOO branch in the details mentioned 2 times
fields.summary: Duplicated branches in issue's development panel

fields.description:
Right now, we have 3 search options while looking at the board backlog.
# The search box.
# The quick filter box.
# The assignee box.

 !Screen Shot 2018-11-15 at 15.14.59.png|thumbnail! 

We would like to implement customized search boxes such as the assignee search box, for example, create a search box for issue type or priority.
fields.summary: Implement customisable search boxes at the board's backlog.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently, there's no way to get the reference of epics and sub-issues (e.g stories). It would be great to have this feature as this allow vendors form the relationship between epics and it's sub-issues.

Use Cases:
# When an app is subscribed to a webhook via the descriptor, there's no way to see which epic the story is linked to
# When an app's feature is to create diagram for epics and sub-issues, there's no way to form it in next-gen projects
fields.summary: Allow apps to create and retrieve links between epics and stories via API in next-gen projects

fields.description:
When a Issue is lined to a Story or another issue, in the "jira.view.issue.links.sort.order" following things can be helpful to use it more effectively:
 # Headers missing
 # Resolution is missing
 # For Priorities only icon is getting displayed whereas we require Priority Name

Kindly look into the matter so that we can use it more effectively and also we are facing usability problems without this things.

Please do the needful at earliest...
fields.summary: Require small changes in "jira.view.issue.links.sort.order"

fields.description:
h3. Description
Using the quick filter for assignee sometimes redirects or reloads the board with a content from a different board or reloads and go to the active sprint bord, also, the URL adds some extra content and does not reflect the search or the URL changes and loads a board that does not belong to the given project

This bug is happening because the username contains a funky character, most of the cases are that the username is using the email of the user.

h3. Steps to reproduce

# At the board, click into the assignee quick filter
** The URL sometimes adds extra path and does not reflect the selection, by clicking again, it will filter
** Sometimes the URL adds extra path and changes the board, loading a different board that does not belong to the project

h3. Expected results
The quick filter should work at the first filter and don't load a different board

h3. Actual results
** The URL sometimes adds extra path and does not reflect the selection, by clicking again, it will filter
** Sometimes the URL adds extra path and changes the board, loading a different board that does not belong to the project

h3. Workaround
There is no workaround at this moment to edit or change the username because it is being deprecated
fields.summary: Using quick filter for assignee sometimes redirects to a different board or to the current active sprint board

fields.description:
h3. Summary
According to [Referencing issues in your development work|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/referencing-issues-in-your-development-work-777002789.html] a merge commit does not associate the issue to the branch. However, merging a branch to master associates data to the issue which is linked to the branch.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In Bitbucket create a branch e.g *TestBranch1* and link it to an issue in JIRA e.g *TEST-1*
# Create another branch *TestBranch2* and link it to another issue *TEST-2*
# Merge *TestBranch1* to the master
# Merge *TestBranch2* to the master having *TEST-1* in the merge commit message

h3. Expected Results
Looking at JIRA issue *TEST-1* only the *TestBranch1* should be associated

h3. Actual Results
Both branches *TestBranch1* and *TestBranch2* are associated to *TEST-1*
fields.summary: Merging branches in Bitbucket associates wrong data from Bitbucket

fields.description:
As a Jira Software user, I want the board's assignee quick filter visible as a dropdown again

The new assignees' quick filter using the users' avatars are difficult to use since the images/pictures are small and it is necessary to hover over them to get the users names.

Also, the quick filter only displays 6 team members and the others remain in a drop down. This is not an easy view/filter.
fields.summary: As a Jira Software user, I want the board's assignee quick filter visible as a drop-down again

fields.description:
Next-gen projects are independent, it means that it's not possible to add system custom fields to next-gen projects.
For example, the workaround provided on https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-31592 will not work for this projects because we can't add the "Free Text Field" and the Text field provided on next-gen project has the limit of 255 characters.

Suggestion:
Ability to use the same custom fields as any other project or add more options on next-gen projects.
fields.summary: Ability to use Free Text Field on next-gen projects
Issue

fields.description: Add Slack Integration area for all users. Right now only admins can add it, and it would be awesome if each one had it in their account sections to define it, and for each project as well.
fields.summary: Add Slack Integration area for all users

fields.description: Save kanban rules in next-gen (like filters) to use in other projects, that way we don't need to define them all from scratch
fields.summary: Save kanban rules in next-gen (like filters) to use in other projects

fields.description: Add checkboxes list option to description field (right next to the bullet points and numbers list)
fields.summary: Add checkboxes list option to description field

fields.description:
On team-managed (formerly next-gen) projects, when we add a label on a ticket, it automatically creates a filter in the board with the options and all new labels that we create, it is added in the filter.
It would be great if we also have this functionality on company-managed (formerly classic) projects.
fields.summary: Label filter on company-managed (formerly classic) Projects

The sidebar all the way on the right seems to be aggressively taking up way too much real estate.

The issue content and comments sections get smushed even when the viewport is wide.
fields.summary: Improve layout for issue view

fields.description:
h3. Description
Using CTRL+Click on issues to move them between backlog and sprint should select the issue and make the action that was selected, however, by using CTRL+Click nothing happens if none of the issues are selected, or it prompts to move another issue that is selected and not the desired issue.

h3. Steps to reproduce
https://cl.ly/270c0ebd7bac

h3. Expected results
Using CTRL+Click should select the issue that the mouse is pointing and perform the action

h3. Actual results
Using CTRL+Click does not refresh the issue that was previously selected not at the desired issue.

h3. Workaround
First select the issue and then CTRL+Click to move between backlog and sprints.
fields.summary: Using CTRL+Click on issues to move them between backlog and sprint does not work

fields.description: A login button.... Just add a login button to the main JIRA public facing website so I can login and use JIRA.
fields.summary: Login Button

fields.description: 我们想在Create Issue时，在关键字段的旁边显示“help”按钮，可以显示一些提示信息。
fields.summary: 重要字段旁边定义“help”按钮

fields.description:
When we detect that a new issue duplicates another one, we need to close it and link to the original ticket.

Currently this requires two actions:
 # Close with resolution=duplicate. In this stage we can enter some text, like "Duplicates issue FOO-1234".
 # Add an issue link from the new issue to the original one that says this issue duplicates FOO-1234.

This should really be a single action. Either add an input box in the "Close" dialog to select the duplicate issue, or "understand" the text "Duplicate of FOO-1234" and add an issue link.
fields.summary: Close issue as duplicate

fields.description:
Currently, it is only possible to rename a next-gen board when there is no active sprint visible on it. 

 !Screen Recording 2018-11-09 at 07.44 PM.gif! 

As a Jira software user, I want to be able to see and rename a next-gen board when a sprint is active on it.

h4. Workaround

The board can be renamed when there is no active sprint on the board
fields.summary: As a Jira Software project admin, I want to be able to rename a next-gen board when a sprint is active

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Customers can't rank their issues if they're using a custom field named *Rank*  in next-gen projects for one of your issue types, because the same custom field is created in *Custom Field* page for classic projects.

When you try to move an issue in the board of your next-gen project, you'll see this error message:
 !Screen Shot 2018-11-09 at 12.43.29.png|thumbnail! 
{code}The ranking of your issue has failed. We are unable to rank your issue. Please try again later{code}

From Splunk, you can see this message as well:
{code} message: The rank custom field with name Rank and id customfield_10020 shares a name with one or more other custom fields. In order to use a rank custom field its name must be unique. {code}

h3. Notes
You won't be able to add issues from your Backlog to a Sprint as well for *any* issue type.
 !backlog.gif! 
No error message will raise in the UI, but you'll be able to see this stacktrace in Splunk:
{code}Encountered error while loading value from external cache. Will fall back to loading values from database. {code}

{code}Caused by: com.atlassian.vcache.ExternalCacheException: Failed due to UNCLASSIFIED_FAILURE at com.atlassian.vcache.internal.memcached.MemcachedUtils.mapException(MemcachedUtils.java:90) at com.atlassian.vcache.internal.memcached.MemcachedStableReadExternalCache.mapException(MemcachedStableReadExternalCache.java:176) at com.atlassian.vcache.internal.core.service.AbstractExternalCache.perform(AbstractExternalCache.java:99) at com.atlassian.vcache.internal.core.service.AbstractExternalCache.perform(AbstractExternalCache.java:74) at com.atlassian.vcache.internal.core.service.AbstractStableReadExternalCache.getBulk(AbstractStableReadExternalCache.java:192) at com.atlassian.vcache.internal.core.metrics.TimedExternalCache.getBulk(TimedExternalCache.java:115) at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.layout.field.ScalableFieldLayoutManagerImpl.lambda$null$45(ScalableFieldLayoutManagerImpl.java:392) ... 120 more{code}

h3. Workaround
Rename the custom field from your next-gen project to a different name than *Rank*. You can use *Ranking*, for example.
fields.summary: Ranking issue doesn't work when it shares a name with one or more other custom fields in next-gen projects

fields.description:
Right now, the only way to "hide" issues from next-gen boards is by deleting the issue or archiving the issue.

The issue will be archived 14 days after you move it to the last column of your board.

Please create the option to *Hide* issues or create the column mapping as the classic board so users can leave issues under a column that is not mapped.
fields.summary: Ability to hide issues from next-gen boards.

fields.description: Hi, my customer wants to add organization at ticket creation in automation rules, and set mail domain in this rules

We need to edit it

fields.description:
At this time, when i turn on Sprints feature from project settings add buttons in board columns just disappear.

It seems that Jira designers decided for users that its not good idea to add new issues to running sprint (board). So they make it hard for them! Only option how to add issue to the running sprint is add it to the backlog and than move it manually to the sprint (board).
fields.summary: As a user of Next-Gen Jira I want to add issues directly to the board when Sprints feature is on

fields.description: Is more bug than suggesting. But i dont have permitions to add bugs that with weird error message (User 'lpikora' doesn't have the 'Assign Issues' permission). So it maybe another bug?
fields.summary: Clonning issue do not copy its attachments.

fields.description:
There is no way how to move issue from issue view (eg. url [https://mapotic.atlassian.net/browse/MAP-353)] from backlog to sprint! 

As a user i have to go to the backlog after creating an issue and scroll down and manually find new issue and then move it to the sprint.

Another bad thing is, that on issue view, there is no information whether issue is in backlog or in sprint - just Status, but it do not tell whether is in sprint or in backlog.
fields.summary: Add option to move Issue to sprint from Issue detail in next gen project

fields.description:
If you have a commit associated to a single Jira issue, and as part of the commit's body you have references to multiple other issue keys, Jira will read all those issues keys and and display this this commit under the development panel of all those issues.

Please improve this integration and allow the customer to choose if Jira will read all issues key or just the first one.

As a workaround, you can change the unrelated issue keys to lower case, Jira will just ignore those issues keys.

Note: It is the same for pull requets, branches, etc.
fields.summary: If a commit have references for multiple Jira issues, the development panel of all those issues will show this commit.

fields.description:
Currently in JIRA, image file types are previewed by expanding on a modal. However, video file types (.webm, .mp4 etc) need to be downloaded in order to be viewed. 

It would be greatly helpful if Jira added video playback support for applicable video formats. 

 

+*Benefits:*+ 
 * User will not have to move away from Current Jira story page to view the video attachment
 * Fewer clicks to get the job done
fields.summary: Play video files inline when user clicks the attachment

fields.description:
As a Jira Software user, I want to be able to reorder the issue's children on the issue's view on next-gen project type.

Currently, it is only possible to move children issues (subtasks or stories) of a given issue in the classic projects.

It would be very helpful to be able to do the same on both classic and next-gen project types.
fields.summary: As a Jira Software user, I want to be able to reorder the issue's children on the issue's view

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian status as of October 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#b2d4ff|titleBGColor=#b2d4ff|bgColor=#eaf1fc}
Hello all,

Thank you for watching, voting, and commenting on this ticket.

As this ticket is a duplicate of JSWCLOUD-17444, we are closing this ticket so that we can aggregate the feedback on a single ticket.

Cheers,
Emily Chan
Product Manager, Atlassian.
{panel} 

Currently, in a next-gen project you can not edit the filter for reading issues from different projects. The backlog only reads from the selected / working project.

 

We have several projects created in Jira Software Cloud (classic projects) and have a project called SCRUM where we create a board for each SCRUM team. Each board reads from several projects an the P.O. organize the backlog of each of them.

 

As I have seen, this can't be done in next-gen projects.
fields.summary: As a Jira Software user, I want to be able to see issues from different projects in the backlog / scrum board, in next-gen projects

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

Jira doesn't currently have a feature that could sync Pull request reviewer with Jira assignee automatically. 

h3. Use Case

For example, when an issue move to review column and assigned to X, I want bitbucket will define the reviewer to be X.
Also I want the other side to be exist, when someone is a reviewer for pull request, the issue should be assigned to him.

h3. Suggested Resolution 

Provide a feature to sync Bitbucket reviewer with Jira Assignee if the user exist in both Apps.
fields.summary: Sync Bitbucket reviewer with Jira Assignee

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Deleting a Child from the context menu of the Roadmap view also removes epic tied to the child issue from roadmap view

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Select an epic on the Roadmap
 # Create a child issue in the issue view
 # Select a new child issue from the context menu so it is displayed with bread crums to the epic
 # Delete the child issue using three dot (...) context menu
 # Parent epic disappears from the Roadmap
 # Epic appears again after refresh


h3. Expected Results
Epic remains in the Roadmap as only the child was removed

h3. Actual Results
The Epic is removed from the roadmap but not deleted
fields.summary: Deleting a child of an epic from the Roadmap cause epic to disappear

fields.description:
I'd like to have the ability to configure how the card background color will behave based on a field condition like if the due date of the issue has been met.

The card color layout adds a single color line that does not have a good visibility, the best option should have the entire card colored.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to be able to configure card background color based on a field condition

fields.description:
Jira Software classic projects (Scrum and Kanban) allows users to define [card colors|https://confluence.atlassian.com/agile063/jira-agile-user-s-guide/configuring-a-board/configuring-card-colours] to quickly identify cards on your board based on Issue Types, Priorities, Assignees, JQL queries, etc.

As a next-gen project type user, I want to be able to configure colours to identify cards following similar mechanisms and triggers.
fields.summary: Custom card colors in team-managed projects

fields.description: When I apply a filter based on Labels, I would like to see all issues whose parent EPIC has got the selected label(s).
fields.summary: Issues should inherit labels from their parent EPIC

fields.description: In the Roadmap view, I'd like to have the estimate of children issues story points for each Epic.
fields.summary: Display sum of children issues story points and time logged for an Epic

fields.description:
Custom fields could be a great and powerful way to customize issues and organize your backlog.

But it's more or less pointless if you can't use them as filters.
fields.summary: Filter on custom issue fields

fields.description: Can anyone give me a clear tutorial just fit the version our company used? I tried Scrum, tried Kanban, only to find out that what tutorial shown is a big difference from the one I am using, I need to use Jira Software to create a series project report(sprint cannot be used), I need to do agile management for ppl who are not available under certain period(Agile is not available), I tried to used portfolio, and only to find out I can just add existing project that had been created, but i need a brand new one! And I want to drag team members inside my board so that they can know the status of our projects but I also cannot find such function, it seems every function shown in tutorial has a big gap with mine, I am the one who suggest boss using this kind of software and my boss asked me to submit a schedule list to them in 2 days! What makes things worse is that no one else in my team know how to use Jira! I feel like I am dying soon! Can anyone come to help???
fields.summary: Project detail

fields.description:
h3. Summary

After adding custom fields to a next-gen project, the fields are not visible on the creation/editing screen


h3. Environment

* Jira Software Cloud 

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Create an issue type, 'Foo'
# Create an issue type, 'Bar'
# Create a custom field, 'My Custom Field' in the 'Foo' issue type
# Add 'My Custom Field' to the 'Bar' issue type

h3. Expected

'My Custom Field' should be visible in Bento for 'Bar' issues.

h3. Actual

'My Custom Field' is not visible in Bento for 'Bar' issues.

 !Screen Shot 2018-11-05 at 8.52.48 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screen Shot 2018-11-05 at 8.53.34 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screen Shot 2018-11-05 at 8.56.39 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes


h3. Workaround

Re-save each of the broken Issue Types (Project Settings *->* Issue Types *->* "Save changes")

You can also try recreating the custom field. It should now appear on the issue view.
fields.summary: Custom fields are not being displayed on next-gen projects

fields.description:
h3. Description

By somehow, when we only have Next-Gen projects created, the issue type Story from the classic projects are being used for the Next-Gen project and makes impossible to create new classic projects
h3. Steps to reproduce

We were not able to reproduce those issues
h3. Errors

The following error is displayed: "For some reason the magic didn't happen. Click Create to try again"
 Although the project isn't created, Jira still creates all of its schemes (issue type, workflow etc).
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!

Splunk
{code:java}
msg:	 Illegal Entity Scope for Entity class (ISSUE_TYPE). Expected entity scope 'GLOBAL' but has scope 'PROJECT'	
    	 stack:	 com.atlassian.jira.scope.IllegalScopedEntityArgumentException: Illegal Entity Scope for Entity class (ISSUE_TYPE). Expected entity scope 'GLOBAL' but has scope 'PROJECT'
	at com.atlassian.jira.scope.EntityScopeUtil.assertGlobalScope(EntityScopeUtil.java:157)
	at com.atlassian.jira.scope.EntityScopeUtil.assertGlobalScope(EntityScopeUtil.java:144)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.config.manager.IssueTypeSchemeManagerImpl.lambda$assertMutatorDoesNotAffectNonGlobalEntities$21(IssueTypeSchemeManagerImpl.java:829)
	at java.util.stream.ForEachOps$ForEachOp$OfRef.accept(ForEachOps.java:184)
	at java.util.stream.ReferencePipeline$3$1.accept(ReferencePipeline.java:193)
	at java.util.ArrayList$ArrayListSpliterator.forEachRemaining(ArrayList.java:1382)
	at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.copyInto(AbstractPipeline.java:481)
	at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.wrapAndCopyInto(AbstractPipeline.java:471)




msg:	 An error occurred while notifying that a project was created	
    	 stack:	 java.lang.RuntimeException: An error occurred while notifying that a project was created
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.project.DefaultProjectService.notifyHandlersOfProjectCreated(DefaultProjectService.java:420)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.project.DefaultProjectService.createProjectInternal(DefaultProjectService.java:357)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.project.DefaultProjectService.createProject(DefaultProjectService.java:320)
{code}
*The problem happens when there's a Next-Gen issue type associated with the GreenHopper (Jira Software) project template. Since the issue type is restricted to the project scope, Jira is unable to proceed with the project creation.*
h3. Workaround

Contact support as it is necessary to remap the issue type back to the classic project
fields.summary: Unable to create classic projects when only Next-Gen projects were created

fields.description:
The language packs contain the following syntax error in their POMs:

{code}
    <artifactId>jira-core-language-pack-cs_CZ</artifactId>

    <build>
        <plugins>
            <plugin>
                <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
                <artifactId>maven-jar-plugin</artifactId>
                <configuration>
                    <archive>
                        <manifestEntries>
                            <Export-Package>
                                com.atlassian.jira_core.languages.cs_CZ.obr.install;version="${project.version}"
                            </Export-Package>
                            <Atlassian-Plugin-Key>tac.jira core.languages.cs_CZ</Atlassian-Plugin-Key>
                            <Bundle-SymbolicName>tac.jira core.languages.cs_CZ</Bundle-SymbolicName>
                            <Bundle-Name>JIRA Core Czech (Czech Republic) Language Pack</Bundle-Name>
                            <Bundle-Version>${project.version}</Bundle-Version>
                            <Bundle-Description>This plugin contains translations for cs_CZ</Bundle-Description>
                        </manifestEntries>
                    </archive>
                </configuration>
            </plugin>
        </plugins>
    </build>
{code}

The string "tac.jira core.languages.cs_CZ" contains a space, which breaks packaging.

Other language packages have the same problem.
fields.summary: Bug: jira-core-language-pack-cs_CZ Atlassian-Plugin-Key/Bundle-SymbolicName contains invalid spaces

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When the end status of a workflow is change for a project and the board, the historical sprint and velocity reports will be broken. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a project and board with the following flow (To Do, In Progress, Done).
# Perform some sprints to generate some reports.
# Change the Done status to Closed in the workflow.
# Update the board to use the new Closed status. 
# Remove the old Done status from the board column configuration (move to unmapped). The status will then dissappear from the column configurations.

 !old done.png|thumbnail! 

Check the Velocity and Sprint reports. 

h3. Expected Results

The reports should still work for historical sprints. 

h3. Actual Results

Sprint report indicates that the issues were removed.

 !sprint.png|thumbnail! 

Velocity report shows no completed issues. 

 !velocity.png|thumbnail! 

 
h3. Notes

Burndown report still indicates the correct completed times. 

h3.Workaround

Add the old status back to the Workflow configuration (without any transition) and map that status to the right most column configuration of the board.
fields.summary: Velocity and Sprint report broken when the end status is changed in the worklfow

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently, in a next-gen project, the backlog section does not show the priority, even if the field is added in the project's settings
h3. Environment

Jira Software Cloud, next-gen project
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Add issues with priorities to the backlog
Add the _priority_ field to the board
Notice that the priority is not shown in the backlog view
h3. Expected Results

Priority will be shown
h3. Actual Results

Priority is not displayed
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no workaround
fields.summary: priority is not shown in backlog cards of next-gen projects

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When moving an Issue from a Classic Project to a Next-gen Project, on the mobile app in the Backlog view, the Issue is labelled with whatever Epic it was linked to in the previous Classic Project. This happens on both Android and iOS.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# In a Classic Project, add an Issue to an Epic (Epic Classic)
# Move that Issue to a Next-gen Project
# View the Issue from the *Backlog* view using the JIRA mobile app

h3. Expected Results
It seems that in the Backlog view, Epic labels are not supposed to be visible so there should be no labels and remain blank.

h3. Actual Results 
An Epic label appears on the Issue of the previously assigned Epic
 !Screenshot_20181102-113100_Jira.jpg|thumbnail! 
 !Next_gen_-_Agile_board_-_JIRA.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
Be sure to remove the Epic label before moving the Issue, if the Issue has already been moved, move back the Issue from the Next-gen Project to the Classic Project, remove the Epic, then move it back to the Next-gen Project.
fields.summary: Moved Issues display Epic label from previous Project on mobile app

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 31 October 2019|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}

Hi everyone,

This ticket is now closed. I have opened [a new ticket|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-18544] to track the remaining custom fields that are offered in Classic, that are currently not offered in Next-gen. We will be looking at ways in which we can solve the same problems without having an explosion in custom field types with overlapping functionality.

Regards,  
Nathan Sturgess
nsturgess@atlassian.com 
Product Manager, JIRA Platform

{panel}

*Original request description:*
h5. Problem Definition
At the moment following types of custom field are available in next-gen project:
* Text (single-line)
* Date
* Number
* Time
* Labels
* Dropdown
* Checkbox
* People (user picker)

Several types such as _multi-line text field_ and _version picker_ is not available currently.

h5. Suggested Solution
Please implement other types of custom fields in next-gen projects as they are available in classic software projects. This is essential for teams that have been using these fields in the classic projects and want to use next-gen projects for their needs.
fields.summary: Custom fields for Next-gen project

fields.description: The control buttons on the transition draft screen change size on hover which causes them flicker if the mouse is close to the edge, check the screencast (I'm not clicking anything, just hovering). I found this on [softwareteams.atlassian.net|https://softwareteams.atlassian.net/] instance.
fields.summary: Transition draft: flickering buttons

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, independent (next-gen) projects cannot have a [project category|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/adding-assigning-and-deleting-project-categories-844500732.html] defined.
h3. Suggested Solution

Provide an ability to define a project category on independent projects.
h3. Why this is important

Although independent projects are meant to be a "create and go" solution for projects, it would be helpful to have a way to categorize them.
h3. Workaround

Contact Atlassian Support.
fields.summary: Allow the use of project categories in next-gen projects

fields.description:
We do have an official documentation with the steps to move issues from next-gen to classic projects, however, next-gen custom fields are not migrated during this process, they are listed as "removed fields" during the last bulk move change step.

 

[Migrate from a next-gen project to a classic project|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/migrate-from-an-next-gen-project-to-a-classic-project-957974933.html]
fields.summary: Next-gen custom fields cannot be migrated to classic projects.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When Kanban board is filtered by an assignee, board's refresh due to an issue update loads all the issues for awhile and then it gets filtered again by the assignee. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have Classic Kanban board with some issues and assign some of it to any user
# Select any user from _Assignee Filter_
# Access a board's issues in a another tab/window and transition the issue
# Access the Classic Kanban board (click on refresh if *The board has been updated: Refresh* appears)

h3. Expected Result
Board gets refreshed while respecting the assignee filter

h3. Actual Result
Board refreshes quickly and for awhile all the issues appears, and then it gets filtered by the selected assignee.

h3. Note
The duration of time when all issues are visible after refreshing board depends on page load, slower the board loads (e.g due to amount of issues) longer all the issues appears before they get filtered.

This is an annoying behaviour when you're performing an action in the board, for example you might select a wrong issue!
fields.summary: Assignee filter is ignored temporarily when board refreshes after an issue update

fields.description:
In RapidBoard.jspa, I can filter by Assignees. The textbox that handles this has its browser autosuggest feature enabled, and this blocks Jira's autocomplete implementation. One has to press the Escape key to view Jira's autocomplete popup.

See examples below:

*When typing*

!https://pbs.twimg.com/media/Dq1JiDSX4AAuEKb.jpg:large!

*After Escape key is pressed*

!https://pbs.twimg.com/media/Dq1JlJuXcAA9OnD.jpg:large!
fields.summary: Disable Browser's Autocomplete in Assignee's Searchbox

fields.description:
h3. Actual behaviour
There is no release option in Next-Gen. I would be great we can have a release option in Next-Gen projects


h3. Workaround

Use classic Scrum/Kanban templates
fields.summary: Release option in Next-Gen projects

fields.description:
h2. Summary
Importing issues via CSV import would allow creation of Sub-tasks that has Epic Links.

h2. Steps to Reproduce
# Import issues form CSV, make sure that you have a sub-task type with an epic link value

h2. Expected Results
* Either importing fails with error message, or issue imported but Sub-task does not have Epic Link.

h2. Actual Results
Imported Sub-tasks contains Epic Link
fields.summary: Importing tasks via CSV allows adding Epic Link to a Sub-task

fields.description:
{panel:title=Status Update 11th May 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ff7f7f|titleBGColor=#ff7f7f|bgColor=#e5e5e5}

Hello Everyone,

We are happy to announce that the ability to customize the configuration of email notifications on next-gen projects is now available on all JSW and JSD next-gen projects. 

More details can be found at [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-articles/Announcement-Project-Level-Email-Notifications-for-next-gen/ba-p/1374538]

We hope this enables our customers to further optimize which email notifications are sent out to users and we look forward to your feedback.

 

Thank you!
Arjoon Som
Senior Product Manager

{panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, it is not possible to configure the notification for the Next-Gen (formerly Agility) projects.

h3. Suggested Solution
Please allow to configure who can to the notifications in different issue activities as in the Classic projects.

h3. Why this is important
Currently, all events are sending the notifications to current assignee, reporter and watchers. This could under/over notified the required personnel in different use case.
fields.summary: Ability to configure the notification recipients

fields.description:
Please add a new filter to the next-gen project backlog to let users choose to show or hide completed issues.
{panel:title=Atlassian Status Update -  22nd June 2020}
Hi everyone!

I'm pleased to announce that *we have shipped to everyone the ability to manually clear your DONE issues at any time*: [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Next-gen-articles/Introducing-manual-board-clearing-for-your-next-gen-Kanban-board/ba-p/1411958#M1379]

Regards,

Ivan Teong

Product Manager, Jira Software
{panel}
 
{panel:title=Atlassian Status Update -  21st May 2020}
Hi everyone!

 

You'd be pleased to know that we have the feature *ready for rollout* to some customers for *early access!*

If you want to be the *first cohort of customers* to get this feature, please register here: [https://forms.gle/bv9HCdLbARfoXrLo6] 

 

Let me know if you got any further questions.

Regards,

Ivan Teong

Product Manager, Jira Software
{panel}
 
{panel:title=Atlassian Status Update -  6th April 2020}
Hi everyone!

I'm Ivan, a Product Manager in Jira Software, and I wanted to update everyone that my team is currently working on the ability to *manually clear issues in the DONE column on an ad-hoc basis.* Please be patient as we just wrapped up our discovery research and design spike, and will be undergoing development work in the next few sprints. The other relevant ticket is here: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-17582

With regards to finding issues that have been cleared from your DONE column, you will be able to do that through the new ISSUE NAVIGATOR in next-gen as stated here [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Next-gen-articles/Introducing-issue-navigator-in-next-gen-projects/ba-p/1339049], which *will ship before manual board clearing*.

Regarding *bringing already-cleared issues back to the board* (which we don't encourage as it might be better to create a new issue instead reflecting the latest thinking about that work), you can simply change the status of the issue.

*NOTE:* the manual clearing option will *only be available in the DONE column on the board view*, and we will *sync that with the board container in the backlog view. This is not a mechanism to filter out completed issues in the backlog list in the backlog view, as the backlog list should be a list containing TO-DO items, and completed work should not appear there.*

Let me know if you got any further questions.

Regards,

Ivan Teong

Product Manager, Jira Software
{panel}
fields.summary: Next-gen project backlog - filter for completed issues.

fields.description: With a possible sync with the CI Deployments integration
fields.summary: Add Versions to Next-Gen projects

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

Parallel Sprints is only available for Classic project where multiple Sprints can start at the same time. However, it doesn't apply for Next-gen boards.

h3. Suggested Resolution

Add feature for Parallel Sprints for Next-gen board just like Classic board.
fields.summary: Add feature for Parallel Sprints in Next-gen board

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, once a Rule is creating in a next-gen board, it is not editable.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide the edit feature for Rules so that user don't need to delete and recreate a Rule to make amendments.
fields.summary: Ability to edit Rules in next-gen boards

fields.description:
Hello, Team, I have Firewall due to some security reasons I have blocked China traffic. 

kindly please update IP list which is came from China region so I can whitelist into the firewall
fields.summary: IP Address Details

fields.description:
h3. Summary
{quote}when I try to move an issue to that Epic from ‘Bulk Operations’ it lists the Epic as “unlabelled-NG-75
{quote}

h3. Steps to reproduce
 # In a next-gen project
 # Create an epic
 # via JQL Search, select some stories
 # choose Bulk Operations
 # select Epic Link
 # see the Epic names are unlabelled

 

h3. Expected Behavior 
the epic names are used instead

 

h3. Workaround 
Use multi-select on the board or the backlog to bulk assign stories to epics:
 !Add-epic-from-backlog.png|thumbnail! 


If you want to update issues that are already in "Done" status instead, you can  then use the below workaround. However please keep in mind that it is using an internal endpoint not officially documented/supported and this workaround might stop working without prior notice:

Send a POST  request to the REST API endpoint https://INSTANCE.atlassian.net/rest/internal/simplified/1.0/projects/PROJECT-ID/issues/EPIC-ID/children providing a list of issue-ids in the request body.

Example:
- IDs of the issues to be updated: 10405, 10203
- Project ID: 10303
- Epic ID: 10519
- Curl command to set the Epic (10519) as a parent to the desired issues (10405 ,10203). Please replace all the things in CAPITAL with the proper values:
{noformat}
curl -D- -u EMAIL:API_TOKEN -H "Accept: application/json" -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{ "issueIds" : ["ISSUE-ID-1", "ISSUE-ID-2"] }' -X POST https://INSTANCE.atlassian.net/rest/internal/simplified/1.0/projects/PROJECT-ID/issues/EPIC-ID/children
{noformat}

In order to get the list of issue-id to update you can:
# Run a search to get the list of issues to update
# Switch to the list view
# Select to display only the issue-key column and export to CSV current columns only. This way you get a CSV file that only contains issue-key and issue-id. You can parse this file in many different ways to just  get a coma separated list of issue-ids surrounded by double quotes


For details on how to authenticate REST API calls using API TOKENS please refer to the  [API tokens|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/api-tokens-938839638.html] documentation page.
fields.summary: Bulk Operations of next-gen issues does not allow you to assign a parent (Epic)

fields.description: As a product manager, in order to track improvement and impediment, I need a report to see calculate Average Weekly WIP, daily WIp or Monthly WIP.
fields.summary: Calculating Average Weekly WIP

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In a scrum board's "Active Sprint" view some issue actions will cause a strange movement (up then down) of the board's scroll (height) position.  This behavior tends to get worse depending on the number of swimlanes and columns that you have.

Other actions like opening the "detailed pop-up" of an issue > transitioning status > focus back on the board will also cause this scroll movement

My tests were made with 35 stories, 90 sub-tasks and 8 columns. Zooming the page will also make it worse.

The behavior is outlined in this video:  [^bug_test.mp4] 


h3. Test notes
* This is happening both on the old and the new issue view

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a scrum board with a good number of columns, swimlanes and issues
# Move the issue between columns, or click on an issue to focus and transition it to another status

h3. Expected Results

The scroll position of the board remains

h3. Actual Results

The scroll position is changed and changed back

h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: Scroll position is changing on some actions with issues on a Scrum Board

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At this moment, after an admin (or user) creates a *Next Gen* (former Agility) project, it is not possible to change its type to a "regular", non Next Gen one (or vice-versa).

 !RP.png|thumbnail! 

 !NGP.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the ability for admins to change the project type of an already created Next Gen project (or vice-versa).

h3. Why this is important
Next Gen projects are a nice way for a team which is not used with Jira to get work started without complexity. Yet, once the project matures, the Next Gen type may not be as flexible as regular projects (at least not at this moment).

h3. Workaround 
Create a new "regular" project then bulk move the issues from the Next Gen project to the new one.
fields.summary: As an admin, I'd like to change a Next Gen (former Agility) project to another type (or vice-versa)

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian status as of June 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#b2d4ff|titleBGColor=#b2d4ff|bgColor=#eaf1fc}
Hi everyone,

This is Mark from the Jira Software team. Great news – we have now released this feature!
 * Time estimation is now a project feature, meaning you can choose the estimation type that fits your need.
 * You can view the total time estimated per issues and per sprints in the Backlog.
 * And you can view the Burnup, Burndown and Velocity reports based on time estimation.   

Thank you again for your suggestion to enable time estimation for team-managed projects.

Best,

Mark
{panel}
Just as story points estimation has recently been shipped in next-gen projects, please also provide the possibility of using a time estimate as an estimation criteria
fields.summary: Provide time estimation for team-managed projects

fields.description:
It would be very useful if the view of the subtasks for a story showed the actual numerical values (hours) for the Original Estimate & Estimated Time Remaining for each of these tasks. See the attached screenshot.

 !image-2018-10-29-09-40-12-731.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Numerical Values (Estimation) displayed in Story sidebar for subtasks

fields.description:
h2. Description:

When linking my organisation to Jira with the new GitHub plugin, everything seems to works and I see my organisation. I used to do it the old way and it was working
h1. Expected result:

After migrating, installing the new plugin and deleting the old DVCS link I would see the development section in my ticket. 
h1. Actual Result:

The development panel is not present. I use to have all my commit, branches, pull request and now nothing is there, even after 3 days! That is very frustrating!
fields.summary: Github plugin integration

fields.description:
Currently, it's possible to print cards on classic projects, but on next-gen projects, this option is not available.

It would be great if we could have this option on next-gen.
fields.summary: Ability to print cards when using a team-managed project

fields.description:
At my company, we usually create a story with multiple sub-tasks.  Whenever the sub-tasks move from column (status) to another these are kept together, the story or a story header appears at the top followed by the sub-tasks slightly indented under the story.

My suggestion is for the ability to click on an icon on the story to hide / collapse all the sub-tasks under the story.

This will make easier to review other stories within the same status (applies to Kanban board).

 
h2. Kaban board - Tech Review colum:

*Before collapsing*:

STORY-123:  Story - xyz (-)
 - TASK-1 -  abc

 - TASK-2 - def

 

Click on the icon next to STORY-123 ((-))

*After collapsing:*

STORY-123: Story - xyz (+)
fields.summary: Ability to collapse story sub-tasks

fields.description:
When viewing Epics in the Epic panel and adjusting their priorities up and down, this does nothing to the priorities of the related children of the Epics. 

The Epic could be moved to the top of the panel, but its children keep in various positions in the backlog.
Instead of sending each of those children to the top, customers would drag and Epic from a lower position in the epics panel to the first spot, and then all of its children will be moved to the top of the backlog as well.
fields.summary: Prioritization of Epics should also prioritize the children issues

fields.description:
I would like to have the ability to grant permissions to users to create projects using shared configurations (i.e. company-managed (formerly classic) Projects). Currently the only way to do that is to grant Administer Jira permissions. This level of access is excessive.

This would allow for one central Jira Admin to create and manage enterprise approved workflows, permission schemes, issue types etc..., but would allow multiple people to create new projects using the approved enterprise configurations.

Currently the permissions are not granular enough to allow this, and anyone who can create a company-managed (formerly classic) project, can also create workflows, notification schemes etc...
fields.summary: I would like to have a permission that grants a "Create company-managed Project Permission", without having to grant "Administer Jira (global permission)"

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Right now there is no Tamil and Sinhalese language support in Jira 

h3. Suggested Solution

Add Turkish as an available language.
fields.summary: Add Tamil and Sinhalese language to Jira

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a pull request in merged in Github, unless there is a commit done, the *Development* field in JIRA is blank.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create pull request in Github and link to JIRA Issue by referencing the Issue key. This will add a pull request to the *Development panel* of the Issue and the *Development* field will be seen as *UNDER REVIEW*
 !Issue_navigator_-_JIRA.png|thumbnail! 
# Merge the pull request
 !_SCRUM-116__Testing_Story_number_CSV_1084_-_JIRA.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The *Development* field is seen has *MERGED*

h3. Actual Results
The *Development* field is blank
 !blank.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
By adding a commit, reverting the merge and then merging back the pull request, the *Development* field gets updated to *MERGED* as expected.
fields.summary: Development field is blank unless there's a commit in a merged pull request in Github

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 12 December 2019|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}

Hi everyone,

Customers can query on Next-gen epics using the _{color:#DE350B}parent ={color}_. If you want to combine Epics from both project types, an example of such a query would be:  _{color:#DE350B}"Epic Link" = NPC-6 OR parent = NJDP-5{color}_

The _Parent_ field can now be selected as a column in the Global Issue Navigator and exported from Jira.

 !Screen Shot 2019-12-12 at 9.57.20 am.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screen Shot 2019-12-12 at 9.58.59 am.png|thumbnail! 

Regards,  
Nathan Sturgess
nsturgess@atlassian.com 
Product Manager, JIRA Platform

{panel}

h3. Original request description
WIth the deploy of the epics and linking the issues to the epics at the Next-Gen projects we can't use the JQL to return issues that are associated to an epic as we can do for classic projects.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create a next-gen project
# Create an epic
# Associate multiple issues to the epic
# Go to Issue Navigator and try to perform the search by Epic Link referencing the Next-Gen epic
# No results are displayed

h3. Expected results
Return the list of issues that are linked to the referenced Epic

h3. Actual results
Use {{parent()}} function to show the child issues of the Epic. Example:
{code}
parent = EPIC-123
{code}
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to be able to use JQL for Epic Link for Next-Gen project epics

fields.description: Most of my projects depend of other Epic in different project and teams. In order to to have an exact vision of dependencies, deadlines and work to accomplish, I truly need to see epics from different projects in my roadmap.
fields.summary: As a project manager, in order to have a big picture of my projects, i need to see epic from different projects in the Roadmap

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Burn up report doesn't show the summary of issues removed from the sprint

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set up a next gen Scrum project with reports
# Add issues to a sprint and start it
# Remove one of the issues from the sprint to generate a scope change
# Stop the sprint and check the Burn up report

h3. Expected Results

The summary of issues removed from the sprint should be shown in the report

h3. Actual Results

The summary is not shown even if the event column already contains the proper description of the event. 

 !report.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Burn up doesn't show the summary of issues removed from the sprint

fields.description:
Hello,

This is a suggestion related to the Search function in Jira: As the subejct states, currently when you click on an issue in the Search (issue navigator) the link opens in the same tab, instead of opening a new tab. It would be nice to be able to click and open many issues while still staying on the search page. It is annoying having to find your way back to the page after each issue you open. 

*Steps to recreate:*

Go to search (issue navigator) and search for a random project. 

Click on one of the issue links in the search. This will open the link in the current tab.

 

Best Regards,

Lars Foldager Nielsen
fields.summary: In Search (Issue Navigator): Suggestion - Open links in a new tab instead of overwriting the current tab

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 25 August 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}

Unfortunately, in light of more urgent priorities, our team is not working on this feature anymore. We know this will disappoint many of you and is not the answer many of you were looking for. We’ll let you know when we are ready to begin work on it.

{panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the default access is set to open and would allow anyone to access the project.
h3. Suggested Solution
Allow configuring default access to allow project owner to set the default access to Private.
h3. Why this is important
If the project owner forgets and does not change the permission, restricted information could be leaked to users who should not have access.
fields.summary: Allow configuring default access for team-managed (formerly next-gen) projects

fields.description:
h3. Summary

This [YouTube video|https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PQa3NFB_LRg&feature=youtu.be&t=138%5C] demonstrates features in next-gen project, which also shows creation of sub-tasks in next-gen project (2:20). However the feature to add sub-tasks is not available in the instance.
h3. Step to reproduce
 # Create a new Scrum/Kanban next-gen project
 # Add an issue to the board in this project
 # Click on the issue to be viewed in new issue view (popup screen)

h3. Expected result

Ability to add sub-tasks in the issue. Please see the screenshot below which is taken from the video:
 !Next-gen project - Create sub-task.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual result
 * There's no feature to create sub-task.
 * Sub-task is not available in *Project settings* > *Issue types* page, and can't be added.
fields.summary: Unable to create Sub-task in next-gen project

fields.description:
If you put the mouse over the *Epic link* field inside an issue card, you will see that it is a hiperlink, this hiperlink will open the issue associated to this card.

Instead of open the issue associated to the card, the hiperlink should filter all issues on this board that are associated to this *Epic*.
fields.summary: Epic link field inside issue card should filter all issues associated to the Epic when selected.

fields.description:
h3. Description:
When trying to add a value to the *Epic Link* field, it is possible to search for available options for this field. 

Originally, in the old issue view, searching for Epic's keys would return the expected results. In the new issue view, the same cannot be observed, as no results are returned when issue keys are provided.

This makes the process of linking an issue to an Epic a little harder in comparison to the old issue view.

h3. Steps to reproduce:
 # Switch to the new issue view
# Access an issue 
# Try searching for an epic using it's *key*

h3. Expected results: 
 * As in the old issue view, the desired record should be returned
 !Screen Shot 2018-10-24 at 6.27.46 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Actual results:
 * No epics are returned, making it harder to link an issue to an Epic
  !Screen Shot 2018-10-24 at 6.35.40 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

* Search by the Epic name instead of its key;
* Or, disable the new issue view in your *Personal settings* by turning off the *Jira labs* feature.
fields.summary: Searching for Epics in the New Issue View does not return expected results

fields.description: Before (2 weeks-ish ago) if user was NOT logged into JIRA once login was completed after clicking a JIRA link in Outlook user ended up on Issue page. Now if user is not logged into JIRA, when clicking a JIRA link in Outlook, after log in, JIRA ends up on dashboard page. If you close the dashboard page tab and click the link again in Outlook the Issue page is displayed. Is adding a lot of app switching and extra clicks to a day...
fields.summary: Clicking JIRA link in Outlook no longer brings up ticket after login, Instead takes user to Dashboard page.

fields.description: There's no way to see or set Epic Link on a Next-Gen Issue Screen. Please add.
fields.summary: Show Epic Link field on Next-Gen Issue Screens

fields.description: Now it is impossible to add Watchers to tickets, but actually it would be nice and quite convenient to have possibility to start watching a ticket and add people who are involved and interested in it.
fields.summary: It is impossible to add Watchers to tickets

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Performing a quick search in a Kanban board remains active after navigating to the backlog section and then back to the board

h3. Environment
Jira Software Cloud, classic Kanban board

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Have a Kanban board with certain issues in different columns.
Perform a quick search in the kanban board to narrow down the number of issues displayed in the board
Navigate to the backlog and then go back to the board itself

h3. Expected Results
All issues in the Kanban board should be displayed

h3. Actual Results
The search is still active, although there is nothing in the _Quick Search_ box

h3.Workaround
When going back to the board, from the backlog, refresh the web page in the browser
fields.summary: quick search on kanban board remains active after navigating to backlog

fields.description:
Please change the viewing of test cases steps.
The use of so many scroll bars bring an unnecessary hassle to the user (to the eye and actual usage). I liked it better how it looked and worked in the previous versions.
 

https://i.gyazo.com/e490ce40d7861087e88c2e1bf578680f.png
fields.summary: Bad user experience on Test case view

fields.description:
I'm on a development team making Jira Add-ons, and we checked out the new UI for viewing our app in the New Jira Software. It looks like this: [https://imgur.com/NcILD5k]

This isn't ideal — we have a responsive UI and it would be great if our users could make the most of that. Currently, it looks like the container ({{.cizwnI}} in the CSS) has a {{max-width: 960px;}} which is keeping it bounded.

Can we have this restriction removed for plugins?
fields.summary: Display Apps/Add-ons at full width in new Jira Software UI

fields.description: On the [Server documentation for custom fields|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/adding-a-custom-field-938847222.html], the Cloud toggle/link takes you to the Cloud docs home, instead of the [corresponding Cloud doc for custom fields|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/adding-editing-and-deleting-a-custom-field-776636410.html].
fields.summary: custom fields - Cloud link broken on Server docs

fields.description:
As a user, I'd like to have the ability to audit the logs to see board modifications or a deletion of a board. Right now, there is no information on logs when a board had a filter changed or if a board has been deleted or who made those changes.

Please, add the logs for boards modifications.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to have the ability to audit the logs to see board modifications or a deletion of a board

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 23 Nov 2018|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
Epics behave slightly differently in next-gen projects and this is one example of that. We are formalizing an issue hierarchy in next-gen projects (where we will have parent/child relationships) rather than using epic links. This will facilitate some cool stuff in the future around reporting and roll up estimation. Unfortunately in the short term, it means when you move issues to next-gen projects you will need to manually assign these issues to the relevant epic.

It's important to note the epic link has not actually been removed in the background- it's just not visible and is not useful within the context of the next-gen project. If you were to move your issues back to a classic project, for example, you would not lose this linkage. Although the 'Epic Name' and 'Epic Colour' custom fields would be lost.

In the future, as we build out the next-gen projects, we will provide an automated mechanism to create the new parent/child relationship based on the epic link but it just isn't something we have got to yet. We apologize we didn't make this clear earlier. We have updated our docs in an attempt to clarify how epics behave when migrating projects. You can review the docs from this [page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/migrate-from-an-next-gen-project-to-a-classic-project-957974933.html].

Cheers,

Atlassian
{panel}
h3. Summary

When an epic from a non next-Gen project is moved to a next-Gen project, the association is removed. All issues associated with the epics will no longer be linked to the epic
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Have 2 projects (Next-gen and non next-gen)
 # Create an Epic from a non Next-gen project
 # Add a child issue to the epic
 # Move the epic to the next-gen project

h3. Expected Result

Epic link remains. The issues are still linked with the epic in the next-gen project even after the move. OR have a better communication around this so user would be aware of this prior to the move.
h3. Actual Result

Epic link is lost
fields.summary: Epic link gets removed when moving an epic from a "classic" project to a "next-gen" project
Allow sprints to be archived

fields.description:
h3. Summary
After integrating a Bitbucket account with a JIRA Core instance (which should not be allowed since JIRA Core doesn't have the necessary capabilities to handle the features provided by the integration and only JIRA Software can be integrated with Bitbucket), a link to the Bitbucket account will be created on the [application navigator|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/creating-links-in-the-application-navigator-776636255.html]. 

This link can't be removed from the navigator since the only method to remove the link created when integrating both applications is by accessing the DVCS feature that is only available on JIRA Software and deleting the integration link from there. This would remove the link from the application navigator automatically.  

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a JIRA Core instance - https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/core/try
# Create a Bitbucket account - https://bitbucket.org/account/signup/
# Initiate the integration procedure from within Bitbucket, as detailed on this documentation page: [Connect Bitbucket Cloud to Jira Cloud applications|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/connect-bitbucket-cloud-to-jira-cloud-applications-814190686.html]
# The integration will fail and the following error message will be displayed: 
{quote}
Error
The add-on failed to be installed: Error calling uninstalled at URL https://yourinstance.atlassian.net/rest/aci/1.0/installation/jira-bitbucket-connector-plugin/uninstall: 401 Client Error: Unauthorized for url: https://yourinstance.atlassian.net/rest/aci/1.0/installation/jira-bitbucket-connector-plugin/uninstall
{quote}
# A link will be created on the application navigator of JIRA referencing to the Bitbucket account
# Remove the link by accessing the Application Navigator page (https://yourinstance.atlassian.net/plugins/servlet/customize-application-navigator) will not be possible.

h3. Expected Results
There are two possible results: 
# Prevent the link from being created after the failed attempt to integrate JIRA Core with Bitbucket
# It should be possible to delete the link created on the application navigator

h3. Actual Results
A link to the Bitbucket account will be created on the application navigator. This link can't be removed until JIRA Software is added on the affected instance. It's only possible to remove the link using the DVCS feature. 

h3.Workaround
It's only possible to *hide* the link by accessing the Application Navigator page (https://yourinstance.atlassian.net/plugins/servlet/customize-application-navigator) until a fix isn't deployed. The procedure to hide links listed on the application navigator is detailed on the following documentation page: 

* [Creating links in the application navigator|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/creating-links-in-the-application-navigator-776636255.html]
fields.summary: Bitbucket link can't be removed from JIRA Core application navigator
